channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'We think we can get him back': Biden, Austin Tice's family hopes alive after journalist disappears in Syria
item.description: President Biden and the family of Austin Tice, an American journalist missing in Syria since 2012, expressed renewed hope for his return. While lacking definitive proof of his location, Biden believes Tice is alive. The US government, through various channels, has been working to secure his release, though the Syrian government previously denied holding him.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US President-elect Donald Trump picks former ambassador to Mexico Christopher Landau for deputy secretary of state
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has nominated Christopher Landau as Deputy Secretary of State. Landau, a former ambassador to Mexico and experienced lawyer, will collaborate with Secretary of State nominee Marco Rubio on implementing an "America First" foreign policy focused on border security, economic growth, and strategic military alliances.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I was with her a lot': Donald Trump describes Italy PM Giorgia Meloni as 'real live wire' after Paris dinner
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump met with various world leaders in Paris, including Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, whom he called a "real live wire." He discussed NATO finances with French President Emmanuel Macron and had a cordial exchange with First Lady Jill Biden.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US targets over 75 sites in Syria to prevent Isis from conducting external operations
item.description: US forces launched airstrikes against over 75 ISIS targets in Syria, utilizing B-52s, F-15s, and A-10s. President Biden declared the collapse of the Assad regime a "fundamental act of justice," highlighting the opportunity for Syrians to rebuild after decades of conflict. Rebels seized control of Homs, celebrating the end of Assad's rule as he reportedly fled to Russia.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Syria being purified': Watch rebel leader Abu Mohammed al-Jolani's victory speech from Damascus mosque
item.description: Rebel leader Ahmed al-Sharaa, formerly known as Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, declared a "historic" victory from Damascus's Umayyad Mosque after his Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) group seized control of the Syrian capital, forcing President Bashar al-Assad to flee to Moscow. Al-Sharaa celebrated the end of Assad's oppressive rule and the purification of Syria from Iranian influence and sectarianism.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Zelenskyy ready for peace': Trump spills the tea over his meetings with world leaders
item.description: During his Paris visit, President Trump revealed President Zelenskyy's newfound desire for peace in Ukraine. Trump discussed potential resolutions with Zelenskyy and emphasized the need for NATO members to contribute fairly. He also had a cordial exchange with Jill Biden at Notre Dame, praising the cathedral's restoration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: A new history is being written in the region after Syria win: Jolani
item.description: Syrian rebels triumphantly entered Damascus, ending the years-long war and toppling President Assad. Rebel leader Jolani addressed a crowd, proclaiming a new era for the region and promising a brighter future for Syria. The rebel coalition initiated the transition of power, while the former PM called for free elections. Released prisoners celebrated their newfound freedom in the streets of Damascus.

item.title: 'A fragrance your enemy can't resist': Trump uses photo with Jill Biden to sell his new perfume
item.description: At the Notre Dame reopening, a shared moment between President-elect Trump and Jill Biden became the subject of a Trump perfume ad. Trump posted a screenshot of a smiling Biden with the tagline, "A fragrance your enemies can't resist," promoting his "Fight Fight Fight" line. The $199 fragrance sparked humorous reactions online, with some speculating about Biden's voting preferences.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meghan Markle hailed as ‘symbol of resilience against adversity’: Royal commentator
item.description: Meghan Markle is viewed as a symbol of resilience by many in the US as she navigates the complexities of her post-royal life. Her openness, along with Prince Harry's mental health advocacy, resonates with Americans who value breaking free from constraints and addressing personal struggles. Harry's memoir and television appearances have further highlighted his journey with anxiety and agoraphobia.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Health insurance under scrutiny following UnitedHealthcare CEO's assassination
item.description: The assassination of UnitedHealthcare's CEO has sparked scrutiny of health insurance practices, particularly the "delay, deny, defend" allegations. The privatization of Medicaid and Medicare, along with rising prior authorization denials, are fueling the debate. The future of ACA subsidies remains uncertain, with potential coverage losses under a Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: FDA considers banning controversial red food dye linked to health risks
item.description: The FDA is poised to ban Red 3, a synthetic food dye linked to cancer and behavioral problems in children. Used in thousands of products, the dye has already been banned from cosmetics. The potential ban follows California's lead and aligns with stricter European standards, addressing growing public health concerns.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Fundamental act of justice': US President Joe Biden on fall of Assad govt in Syria
item.description: US President Biden declared the Assad regime's collapse in Syria a "fundamental act of justice" but acknowledged the risks. While crediting US efforts, he expressed concern over the rebel group's past, confirming continued US troop presence to combat ISIS and pursue the return of journalist Austin Tice.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Photographer Hannah Kobayashi’s disappearance linked to mystery man and a potential scam
item.description: Photographer Hannah Kobayashi, who disappeared from Los Angeles, was seen spending nine hours with a man before traveling to Mexico. Police cleared the man of any involvement, confirming Kobayashi left alone and voluntarily crossed the border. A possible marriage scam involving an Argentinian man and family tensions further complicate the situation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Senator Ernst raises concerns over Hegseth’s nomination for defence secretary
item.description: Senator Joni Ernst, a combat veteran, expresses reservations about Pete Hegseth's nomination for defense secretary, citing concerns about his views on women in combat and past allegations. Hegseth faces scrutiny over sexual assault accusations and a lack of Pentagon experience, while other Republican senators also seek further information before confirming his nomination.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Syrian ousted president Bashar al-Assad in Russia: Report
item.description: Bashar al-Assad and his family have found asylum in Moscow after fleeing Damascus as Islamist-led opposition forces took control of the Syrian capital. Celebrations erupted in Syria following the rebels' swift advance, ending the Assad family's five-decade rule.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Internet reacts as Trump and Jill Biden share candid moment at Notre Dame reopening
item.description: During the reopening of Notre Dame Cathedral, President-elect Donald Trump and outgoing First Lady Jill Biden shared a warm, viral moment. This fueled online speculation about Jill Biden's stance on Trump, particularly given prior instances interpreted by some as signs of covert support.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Brian Thompson case: Nationwide manhunt for UnitedHealthCare CEO’s killer continues
item.description: A nationwide manhunt is underway for the gunman who fatally shot UnitedHealthCare CEO Brian Thompson in Midtown Manhattan. The suspect, seen fleeing on an electric bike and later in a taxi, is believed to have left New York City shortly after the attack. A backpack possibly belonging to the suspect was found in Central Park.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Assad is gone': Trump, Netanyahu, other world leaders react to Damascus falling to rebels
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When USA called Syria rebel leader Abu Mohammed al-Jolani a terrorist
item.description: In 2017, the US Embassy in Syria declared Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, leader of Hay’at Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), a terrorist. The US asserted that HTS, despite rebranding efforts, remained an al-Qaeda extension, with Jolani at its helm. This designation highlighted the complex dynamics of the Syrian conflict and raised questions about US involvement with extremist groups.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Deport all Illegal immigrants, exit Nato, pardon Jan 6 defendants: Trump lays out his agenda
item.description: In his first post-election interview, President-elect Trump outlined his second-term agenda, including pardons for January 6th rioters, ending birthright citizenship, and mass deportations. He also discussed potential NATO withdrawal, tariffs, and a more unifying message than his previous inaugural address. Surprisingly, Trump met with Macron and Zelenskyy in Paris after the interview to discuss peace in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
